prompt_to_run:
You will be given a task consisting of two parts:
1. A word-learning phase where you will be shown examples of a new word and give a similarity score of the word.
2. A similarity judgement phase where you will be asked to rate the similarity of pairs of objects for a total of 50 objects.


Mr. Frog speaks a different language, and you are helping him to pick out the object he wants. You'll be given a novel word and some examples of the word.

Here is a fep:
1. green bell pepper

Now pick out the other feps from the following list:
1. crane
2. red bell pepper
3. seal
4. onion
5. Labrador
6. chiller truck
7. yellow bell pepper
8. pumpkin
9. box truck
10. cat
11. car
12. basset hound
13. bear
14. Dalmatian
15. green bell pepper
16. eggplant
17. bee
18. full-trailer truck
19. carrot
20. loader
21. school bus


Next, for each pair of the objects below, rate the similarity of the two objects on a scale of 1 (not similar at all) to 9 (extremely similar). Try your best to base your ratings on the same aspects of the objects that were important to you in making your choices during the word-learning phase:

1. eggplant and school bus
2. cat and chiller truck
3. seal and Labrador
4. tractor and chiller truck
5. garbage truck and full-trailer truck
6. toucan and semi-trailer truck
7. loader and school bus
8. potato and red bell pepper
9. crane and mutt
10. semi-trailer truck and school bus
11. Dalmatian and yellow bell pepper
12. terrier and yellow bell pepper
13. green bell pepper and pig
14. crane and carrot
15. potato and school bus
16. garbage truck and pig
17. potato and box truck
18. red bell pepper and full-trailer truck
19. crane and tractor
20. school bus and Labrador
21. green bell pepper and school bus
22. tractor and toucan
23. garbage truck and semi-trailer truck
24. semi-trailer truck and full-trailer truck
25. chiller truck and yellow bell pepper
26. loader and bear
27. onion and school bus
28. bear and semi-trailer truck
29. green bell pepper and eggplant
30. crane and potato
31. bear and tractor
32. pumpkin and motorcycle
33. box truck and red bell pepper
34. cat and red bell pepper
35. toucan and car
36. toucan and full-trailer truck
37. cat and crane
38. crane and seal
39. cat and green bell pepper
40. eggplant and box truck
41. Dalmatian and motorcycle
42. bear and chiller truck
43. pumpkin and green bell pepper
44. pig and yellow bell pepper
45. onion and seal
46. onion and pig
47. basset hound and carrot
48. green bell pepper and garbage truck
49. bee and chiller truck
50. carrot and full-trailer truck


The output should be formatted as a JSON instance that conforms to the JSON schema below.

As an example, for the schema {"properties": {"foo": {"title": "Foo", "description": "a list of strings", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["foo"]}
the object {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]} is a well-formatted instance of the schema. The object {"properties": {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]}} is not well-formatted.

Here is the output schema:
```
{"properties": {"objects_chosen": {"description": "objects that the word applied to", "items": {"type": "string"}, "title": "Objects Chosen", "type": "array"}, "choice_explanation": {"description": "explanation of objects chosen", "title": "Choice Explanation", "type": "string"}, "similarity_score": {"additionalProperties": {"type": "integer"}, "description": "similarity score for each pair of objects", "title": "Similarity Score", "type": "object"}}, "required": ["objects_chosen", "choice_explanation", "similarity_score"]}
```

Please be sure to give similarity scores to ALL 50 pairs of objects listed above.
